entry.tran: 令人大吃一惊的;令人震惊的
entry.def: Something that is staggering is very surprising.

example.ex: ...a three-year contract reputed to be worth a staggering £5,000-a-week...
example.tran: 据称高达每周 5,000 英镑的三年期合同

example.ex: The results have been quite staggering.

means.word_mean: 2. so surprisingly impressive as to stun or overwhelm;

sentences.sentence: "the amount of money required was staggering"
"the figure inside the boucle dress was stupefying"

auth_sentence.content: Some of the losses in individual cases are staggering.

auth_sentence.content: The scope and depth of Plastic Beach is staggering.

sentences.en: Profits have shot up by a staggering 25%.
The public response was absolutely staggering.
sentences.cn: 公众的反应非常令人惊愕。

sentences.en: The sheer volume of fiction produced is staggering.
